bug.short_desc: [1.8][code assist] code assist after lambda as a parameter does not work

long_desc.thetext: (In reply to Manoj Palat from comment #0) > List<Integer> l = new ArrayList<Integer>(); > l.forEach(s -> System.out.println(s)); /* replace lambda with null and the > following works*/ > l./* Press Ctrl-space before this comment */ Issue: Here without lambda, lists all the options while if the lambda is present in the code above, no option is shown

For the case in comment#3 I raised https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=427532 since it seems to be a different issue.
For the present problem, fix and tests released here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?h=BETA_JAVA8&id=c29ff6f3ca53453d86d6a9de68da632d3d253455

Verified with older builds auto completion does not list the functions associated with List l.
With Eclipse Kepler 4.3.2(RC4) works.
Verified as working for Eclipse + Java 8 RC1 Eclipse Kepler 4.3.2(RC4) Build id: M20140212-0800 + Eclipse Java Development Tools Patch for Java 8 Support (BETA) 1.0.0.v20140220-2054.
